description.narrative: The project will contribute to help transforming seafood market by mainstreaming sustainability in the supply chain of important fisheries commodities (tuna and BSC) from Indonesia, through use of public-private platforms.
seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Blue Swimming Crab fisheries in Sumenep, Pamekasan
Central Government/ Min. of Marine Affairs and Fisheries and Min. of PPN/ BAPPENAS

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Longline tuna fishery in Benoa Port, Bali

description.narrative: seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Pole and line and handline fisheries in Bitung Port

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Number of Sustainable Marine Commodities Platforms created with project support and functional. 2. Number of Sustainable Fisheries Action or Management Plans under implementation as a result of project support 3. Number of FIPs uploaded to FisheryProgress.org, have progressed by at least one grade, or have maintained an ‘A’ grade with project support 4. Number of additional fisheries in certification process (have entered process, undergoing assessment, or have been certified)

comment.narrative: 2018 1. No Sustainable Marine Commodities Platforms created with project support and functional. 2. Tuna Fisheries Management Plan is nearly expired and No harvest strategy available for BSC 3. Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery at sustainability grade A, Indonesia blue swimming crab trap fisheries in sustainability grade A, Indian Ocean and Western Center Pacific Ocean longline-tuna fisheries is inactive in FisheryProgress.org 4. No fisheries in certification process (have entered process, undergoing assessment, or have been certified)

1. Formalizing and operationalizing Sustainable Marine Commodities Platforms 2. Finalizing Study on allocation for Fish Aggregating Device, database for Indonesia’s tuna vessel as part of implementation of Tuna Fisheries Management Plan, draft of Indonesia BSC Fisheries Management Plan as a 5-year strategic guidance for management of BSC 3. Maintaining Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery at sustainability grade A, Indonesia blue swimming crab trap fisheries in sustainability grade A, Indian Ocean and Western Center Pacific Ocean longline-tuna fisheries is in grade A in FisheryProgress.org 4. Developing lesson learn for Fishery Improvement Project to enter the ecolabel certification process

1. Sustainable Marine Commodities Platforms has been successfully formalised through Decree of Deputy Minister of Maritime Affairs Natural Resources of Ministry of National Development Planning/ BAPPENAS number 65/D.III/07/2021 on the establishment of Working Group for SDG14 2021-2024. The Working Group consists of representative from multi-stakeholders, including women fisher association, which will focus in supporting the realization of sustainable use of marine and fisheries resources that will directly contribute to achieving Goal 14 of Sustainable Development Goals, and parallelly the 2020-2024 Medium Term National Development Planning. 2. The project has completed study to support MMAF in improving management of use of Fish Aggregating Device (rumpon) in Indonesia’s fisheries, which determined numbers of locations that are allocated for rumpon placement in all the 11 Indonesia Fisheries Management Areas (WPPNRI). It has been formalized through Minister Decree of MMAF No 7/2022; the database for Indonesia’s tuna vessel as part of implementation of Tuna Fisheries Management Plan has been completed and publicly available at http://integrasi.djpt.kkp.go.id/tunavessel/beranda; the National Tuna Fisheries Management Plan has been formalized through Ministerial Decree of MMAF No 121/ 2021, and Blue Swimming Crab Fisheries Management Plan has been completed and currently under review of Bureau of Regulation for further formalization through MMAF Decree 3. Rating of Fishery Improvement Project for Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery at grade A, Indonesia blue swimming crab trap fisheries in grade A, Indian Ocean and Western Center Pacific Ocean longline-tuna fisheries in grade A. All the ratings are publicly accessible at FisheryProgress.org 4. Series of lesson learn for Fishery Improvement Project and Platform work in fisheries have been developed

1.Timely project closure of the Project grant. 2.Process the project handover notes to the Implementing Partner 3. Submitted final project terminal evaluation to the project board members and GEF OFP Indonesia. 4. Transferred all project knowledge products, data and information for future audit purposes to UNDP Programme team in the form of digital information and/or hardcopy documents.

1. The project is closed on the 26 March 2022 2. Handover of goods and assets to the Implementing Partner when CDR Q1 2022 has been processed 3. Final project terminal evaluation has been approved by project board members 4. Transferred all project knowledge products, data and information for future audit purposes to UNDP Programme team in the form of digital information and/or hardcopy documents.

1. Developing Legal and Operational Framework for National Fisheries Platform 2. Finalising the Tuna FIsheries Management Plan, and BSC harvest strategy 3. Maintaining ratings of Fisheries Improvement Projects (FIPs) as pilot fisheries for demonstration projects 4. One fisheries meet all the requirement for entering ecolabel certification

1. Legal basis and framework for Sustainable Marine Commodities Platforms determined. A policy analysis conducted identify that the Platform can be established through a Joint Regulation or Joint Ministerial Decree related to the marine and fisheries sector, and chaired by the Coordinating Minister who coordinates maritime affairs, and consists of related government ministries/agencies especially MMAF, BAPPENAS, and Ministry of Home Affairs, business actors, universities, non-governmental organizations, indigenous peoples, and other stakeholder elements. 2. Draft of Tuna Fisheries Management Plan has been publicly consulted, and BSC harvest strategy is launched by Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries. The Limit Reference Point (LRP) for the blue swimming crab fishery in the harvest strategy uses Spawning Potential Ratio (SPR) as the indicator, which is at 20% with the Target Reference Point (TRP) is set at 30%. The Tuna Fisheries Management Plan recommends several actions include implementation of allocation for Fish Aggregating Device, establishment of database for Indonesia’s tuna vessel, and study to determine gender roles in the fishery. 3. Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery at sustainability grade A, Indonesia blue swimming crab trap fisheries in sustainability grade A, Indian Ocean and Western Center Pacific Ocean longline-tuna fisheries is in grade C in FisheryProgress.org 4. Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery enter ecolabel certification process for Marine Stewardship Certification. This assessment will cover 307 fishers and 73 pole-and- line vessels which contributed around 11,000 tonnes tuna.

1. Establishing National Fisheries Platform 2. Finalization of root cause analysis of capture fisheries 3. Improved ratings of Fisheries Improvement Projects (FIPs) as pilot fisheries for demonstration projects 4. Finalization of fisheries action plan/ road-map

1. Root cause analysis developed with inputs from stakeholders for the establishment of platform involving different range of stakeholders in the fisheries 2. Draft of Tuna Fisheries Management Plan is in development phase with expert and input from stakeholders, with a stakeholder workshop provided recommendation for management measure including management of Fish Aggregating Device. BSC harvest strategy is in development phase with data from GMC-supported fishery improvement project implemented by APRI. 3. Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery at sustainability grade A, Indonesia blue swimming crab trap fisheries in sustainability grade A, Indian Ocean and Western Center Pacific Ocean longline-tuna fisheries is inactive in FisheryProgress.org 4. No fisheries entering certification process for Marine Stewardship Certification. The GMC-supported the Indonesia Western Center Pacific Ocean yellowfin and skipjack tuna-pole and line fishery improvement project closing several gaps in the requirement.
